hadiths.english_translation: Tribe affiliation Taym al-Rabb. Sufyan said: From Khalaf, he said: Jawwab used to tremble at the remembrance of Allah. So Ibrahim al-Nakha'i said to him: If you could control it, I would not care at all to account for you, and if you could not control it, then you have indeed contradicted one who is better than you

narrators.name: Sufyan
narrators.full_name: Sufyan ibn Said ibn Masruq al-Thawri

narrators.name: Khalaf

narrators.name: Ibrahim al-Nakha'i

chainIssues: The chain is complex: Sufyan reports from Khalaf about Jawwab's trembling, and then Ibrahim al-Nakha'i's response is embedded as direct speech
The transmission through Khalaf uses 'an (عَنْ), which could be ambiguous
This is a dialogue/anecdote within a biographical entry

potential_issues.issue: Complex narrative structure with embedded dialogue
potential_issues.impact: The hadith contains a reported anecdote about Jawwab trembling when remembering Allah and Ibrahim al-Nakha'i's response to him, but this lacks a clear continuous isnad

potential_issues.issue: Character comment from Ibrahim al-Nakha'i about Jawwab's trembling
potential_issues.impact: This appears to be a critical or evaluative comment on Jawwab's emotional response to Allah's remembrance, interpreted in the context of religious devotion

Topics: Incident of Jawwab ibn Ubaidullah trembling at the remembrance of Allah

hadiths.english_translation: And Muhammad ibn al-Fuday said: From al-A'mash, from Ismail ibn Raja': That he used to gather the boys and narrate hadith to them so that he would not forget his hadith

potential_issues.impact: While al-A'mash is classified as a category 2 mudallis and is generally reliable, his use of 'an should be noted. However, category 2 tadlis is considered acceptable by most scholars

potential_issues.issue: Biographical anecdote about Ismail ibn Raja's method of preserving hadith

hadiths.english_translation: Client of Hilal Banu Amir. He said: I heard Wakee' ibn al-Jarrah mention Abd al-Malik ibn Maysarah, so he said: That is the Armor-maker, and he was reliable, prolific in hadith. He said: And Abd al-Malik died during the governorship of Khalid ibn Abdullah al-Qasri in Kufa

narrators.name: Unknown narrator
narrators.full_name: Unknown client of Hilal Banu Amir

potential_issues.impact: The entry begins with 'He said' referring to an unknown person described only as 'client of Hilal Banu Amir', making the first link in the chain unidentified

potential_issues.issue: Character testimony from Wakee' ibn al-Jarrah
potential_issues.impact: Wakee' attests to Abd al-Malik's reliability and prolific hadith transmission, identifying him as 'the Armor-maker' (al-Zarrad)
The entry reports that Abd al-Malik died during the governorship of Khalid ibn Abdullah al-Qasri in Kufa, which places his death around 118-120 AH

Topics: Character testimony of Wakee' ibn al-Jarrah about Abd al-Malik ibn Maysarah
